topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (Beta): Deleting a Router

body.p: A network connects to the router through an interface.
You must remove all router interfaces before deleting the router, by removing all internal interfaces.

section.title: Delete a router

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Network Topology link.
Determine if the router is connected to a network using the Network Topology screen:
Click the Routers link on the Project dashboard Network panel.
The routers for the selected project appear.
If the router is connected to a network:
a. Click the name of the router you want to delete.
b. On the Router Details screen, select the interface(s) for the router and click **Delete Interface**.
c. Return to the Routers screen.
For the router you want to delete, click More > Delete Router.
In the confirmation window, click Delete Router.
